definition: house with more than 1 story/storied building/floor/CL:層|层[ceng2],座[zuo4],棟|栋[dong4]
towering buildings are built up from the ground (idiom)/great oaks from little acorns grow
pinyin: wan4 zhang4 gao1 lou2 ping2 di4 qi3

sentences.english: Luo city have door and the high-rise.
sentences.chinese: 例句与用法罗城的四面修有城门，上起高楼。

sentences.english: There’re blue sky，beautiful trees and big buildings ahead.
sentences.chinese: 晴空丽日，前面是婀娜多姿的树木和高楼大厦。

sentences.english: Procumbens flowers as red as fire, alone on the high-rise self-help Guoqin.
sentences.chinese: 陌上花开红似火，独上高楼自扶琴。

sentences.english: High buildings rise from the flat ground.
The Wong Tai Sin Temple is much older than the surrounding high-rise buildings.
sentences.chinese: 黄大仙祠比较周围的高楼大厦年代久远得多。

sentences.english: Look at that building across the street from us.
sentences.chinese: 你看看我们对面街上的那幢高楼。

sentences.english: We know he can leap over tall buildings and pick up cars with bare hands.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道，超人可以跳越高楼大厦，徒手抓起汽车。

sentences.english: Colorfully lit high- risers give off dazzling light in the darkness.
sentences.chinese: 多姿多彩的高楼大厦，在夜色中绚烂夺目。

sentences.english: I mean, it’s just a tall building where you go out on the roof in the middle of Manhattan.
sentences.chinese: 我的意思是，爬到曼哈顿中区一幢高楼的顶楼平台。

sentences.english: The fields where I played as a child have been built over.
sentences.chinese: 我儿时玩耍的那些田野现在已盖满了高楼大厦。

sentences.english: The heavy haze has covered many buildings in our country, including the Petronas Twin Tower.
sentences.chinese: 烟霾的已经盖过了我国的许多高楼大厦，包括双峰塔。

sentences.english: When the old granny first came to the city, she goggled at the size of the buildings.
sentences.chinese: 当老太太初次进城时，她瞪大眼睛盯住那一座座高楼。

sentences.english: Murky brown water grows to roof tops and lapped around the high-rises.
sentences.chinese: 浑浊的棕色河水已经升到屋顶，拍打着高楼大厦。

sentences.english: Glass-wall cleaning robot is one of robots for limited operation, which can walk on vertical glass-wall with washing devices.
sentences.chinese: 高楼玻璃幕墙清洗机器人是特种机器人的一个分支。

sentences.english: Our new flat is in a high building near Beidajie Street.
sentences.chinese: 我们的新家在北大街附近的一座高楼里。

definition: a building of two or more stories/CL:棟|栋[dong4],幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
building (a relatively large, multi-storey one)/CL:幢[zhuang4],座[zuo4]
(used in the names of grand buildings such as 百老匯大廈|百老汇大厦 Broadway Mansions (in Shanghai) or 帝國大廈|帝国大厦 Empire State Building etc)
dangerous housing/building that is about to collapse
top floor/attic/loft/garret/penthouse/(flat) rooftop (often used as an outdoor living area etc)
